channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: An Indian family loaned Rs 35,000 to the British and now wants it back. Why?
Anthropic faces blacklisting by Pentagon. Why is the AI firm battling with Trump administration?
Can King Charles save Veeraswamy, UK’s oldest Indian restaurant?
Has Iran rebuilt its nuclear programme as US claims?
Why has Saudi Arabia banned poultry, egg imports from India and 39 other countries?
Explained: The significance of Yad Vashem, Holocaust memorial, Modi is visiting in Israel
Calibrated engagement: PM Modi’s Israel visit signals India’s nuanced West Asia doctrine in motion
item.description: West Asia will remain complex. But complexity, handled with patience and prudence, can be an opportunity rather than a liability.

item.title: PM Modi in Jerusalem: How aerospace, AI and Iron Dome are the next chapter in India-Israel ties
item.description: Future India-Israel defence cooperation will focus heavily on joint development, co-production and technology transfer in cutting-edge areas such as AI, cyber and drones

item.title: A new regional flashpoint: How Pakistan-Afghanistan tensions threaten South Asian stability
item.description: New Delhi must balance its desire to maintain stability in Kabul with its scepticism of the Taliban regime, while avoiding direct entanglement in the worsening Pakistan-Afghanistan rift

item.title: Trump’s Iran calculus: Is regime change the endgame?
item.description: The fact that the US is moving massive military forces and has not pulled back suggests a readiness for action rather than mere deterrence

item.title: Why Hormuz, not Fordow, is the real centre of gravity in the Iran crisis
item.description: The central policy variable in the confrontation is not the technical status of Iran’s nuclear programme but the stability of a critical global chokepoint

item.title: Waiting for the hammer: Iran’s regime on the brink as Trump holds the final nail
item.description: History shows us that all brutal regimes have expiry dates. The mullahs' is here
